home.title:
Kopacze
-
Diggers
home.content:
We're queer, activist living space aimed at hosting workshops, retreats and events around social and environmental struggles.
 We are committed to  living in an ecological way, and are cultivating our own style of  permaculture. For the  past years we have been working on the  garden, making lots of  preserves and generally familiarising ourselves with our surroundings. We have been renovating the  space as well and a number groups have met in Kopacze. in 2018 we have organized a queer-feminist camp. Second edition of the camp wil take place this summer! Scroll down for more information.
home.campBody:
The camp will take place between 30.07.21 and 6.08.21.
We are committed to creating a safer space for everyone. So we invite people of all gender identities, psychosexual orientations, skin colors, origins, ages and economic statuses.
The camp itself, as well as the Kopacze-Diggers project, is to be a trans*-friendly place, sex(work)positive, vegan, anti-racist, queer and feminist (and we would like to emphasize strongly that for us feminism is inextricably linked with the rights of trans people).
Our goal is for the community that will form during the camp to co-organize it in the most non-hierarchical way possible.
We want to be able to share knowledge and skills without any obstacles during the camp, but also to rest in nature and escape the overwhelming reality of oppression (we assume the possibility of creating spaces in the camp available only for specific groups). We hope that the program will include workshops and talks, but also free time spent together. We are also focused on strengthening practical skills (building, gardening, working with the body). The camp will partially be an alcohol-free space.
Camp participants will sleep in their own tents, all infrastructure is in the open air (field showers, compost toilets, kitchen, dining room and workshop spaces). We have the capacity to accommodate up to 35 people. We invite people with children, but we cannot provide organized care for them - however, we hope that people coming with children will organize some form of care for them. Unfortunately, the camp area is not friendly to people with mobility difficulties: please contact us so that we can tell you about the obstacles and possibilities of our space. If you are taking care of an animal, we recommend that you do not take it with you to the camp if you can. Our experience shows that a lot is going on during the camp and it is difficult to combine full participation with taking care of an animal, which is additionally exposed to a lot of stimuli. The working languages of the camp will be Polish and English, and if necessary, we will try to organize a group of translators into Russian.
Applications are accepted until June 30, 2021.
Contribution for camp costs (including food) is 300PLN per person from 15 years of age, people under 14 years of age - 100 PLN. We will need a non-returnable advance of 100PLN/person. If you have the means to pay more and thus support the project and other participants - great! We encourage you to donate more. If you want to participate in the camp but the suggested fee is too high, contact us.
If you agree with our values and want to co-create this camp, fill in the application form! We will send you detailed information about the space, logistics and other practical things that you should know before coming to the camp.
home.optionsList:
Help us finding funding possibilities
Come over for a visit
Come over to  help out
Donate things (tools, firewood, construction materials)
Organize a workshop, event or retreat
Come over for isolation or to  practice self-care

about.title: About us
about.content: We are a group of  people coming from different areas of  activism, such as: feminism, queer, animal rights, human rights, deep ecology. We are a house collective aiming at creating new patterns of  relationships with each other and others around us. We want our home to  be safer space for ourselves and all those, who want to  come here.
about.aboutSpace:
There's plenty of  space here. We are surrounded by forests, medows and fields, with a little pond just behind our house. the  farm itself consist of  couple of  buildings - an old barn which is going to  become our main workshop space in the  future, three workshop spaces and house with an attic.
At the  moment we have the  capacity to  host groups of  6-8 people and bigger groups in summer (camping and working outside in provided outdoor facilities).

supportUs.title: Support us
supportUs.content:
We're currently in need for hand tools, power tools, all kind of  construction materials and building stuff (wood, clay, firebricks, windows).
Seeds and plants are welcome as well!
We're also looking for means of  financial support, if you have any ideas or skills you would like to  share in this topic, contact us!
We appreciate any kind of  physical help, if you want to  come and help by doing something, drop us a line, we'll tell you, what is currently going on and what kind of  help would be useful.
If you have any knowledge or skills in the  areas of  construction, electrics, renovation, roofing, windowing, etc you would like to  share, we would be very happy to  learn!
